title: long types are written to a file as one looong line

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: D-diagnostic-infra
labels.description: Issues that affect all diagnostics, or relate to the diagnostic machinery itself

body:
### Current output

With a long type in an error the compiler will write the type to a file rather than to the screen, and instead write this:
```Shell
note: the full type name has been written to '/target/wasm32-unknown-unknown/release/deps/x-8006b700d2e73017.long-type-6230284475292204263.txt'
```

### Desired output

It would be awesome if the type could be formatted to be multiple lines as it's a big type and we have a whole file to show the type's name in.

### Rationale and extra context

Could we pipe it through rustfmt or just use a # while printing the type to the file? It would just make life a little easier. (this could also be helpful if people happened to be using diff tools against these types to see what changed)
